turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Can a -- can a claimant under a compensatory statute cut down the amount of recovery below the statutory maximum?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb

turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well, why can't -- if he does that, then why isn't the Chief Justice's question controlling.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Because --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: (Voice Overlap) -- says the statute enables me if this is tried out against $14,000 but I think an honest man or my lawyer having shaking me down on what really happened to me, can only claim $8000.
Is he allowed to do that?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: In -- in this case, he could be, yes, sir.
If -- if this claim --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: In any event, (Inaudible) case put by the Chief Justice.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Well, he would asked about lawsuit, and I -- I feel --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: No, no, he -- put your specific case.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Alright, sir, if the claim that he made was vague and indefinite before the Board and could not be determined, yes, sir.
We would not be here.

But in a case where the Supreme Court says that the amount in controversy between the parties of Supreme Court of Texas says that the amount in controversy between the party is what the employee claims before the Board.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But -- but can't the man cut down his claims?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Is your -- are you so humanistic in Texas that if appellant's (Inaudible) only to the tune of $9000, the court says "Oh, no, but you may get $14,000?"
I believe that's the thing about Texas but --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Sir?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- not that.[Laughter]

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Sir?

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Isn't this the answer to that?
Until he does file a counterclaim for an amount less than the $10,000 in the federal court under the Booth case, the amount made in the claim must stand for the amount, is --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: -- that not right?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir and he can -- and he can go to file on that.
He --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But Mr. Cobb, the Chief Justice gave a supposition which negative to that.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Exactly.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Well, the -- maybe I miss the point completely.
I'm sorry, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I must say -- I don't think you fully comprehended the Chief Justice's question.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Then -- then I --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: He does precisely what Justice Whittaker just put in legal terms, namely, he formally said, "My counterclaim will be only for $9999."

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Then after -- then after that point, if he abandons the rest of his claim, then we would not be here.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Well, that's -- that's the -- that's the point that remained.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Alright, sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: The court wouldn't have jurisdiction if all he was seeking in -- in that court was less than $10,000 and that court would not have jurisdiction.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: But the -- at -- at that time yes, sir.
But when it was originally brought and when the liability was in excess of $10,000, I think that they had jurisdiction up until the time the counterclaim for less than that was filed.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: But that would divest the -- the court of jurisdiction.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I think it would be a judicial mission that he wouldn't entitle to more than the -- the Supreme -- than the jurisdictional amount.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Alright.
Now, let me ask you one other question please.

Suppose that the petitioner have -- have beat the respondent to the courts, I suppose you've gotten to the county courthouse before you got to the federal court, would your -- would the District Court have any jurisdiction then?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: The -- the United States District Court?

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: No, sir.
We -- we could not remove the case.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: You couldn't remove.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: And -- and second reason is that when the award is appealed from, it's vacated and then there's nothing left for us to find and file a lawsuit in the federal court.
He is there -- he is there, and we've prevented from removal, and there is no award to appeal from.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: So the -- so you think it's just a question of -- of a race between the courthouse and the federal courts to determine jurisdiction in this manner?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: No, I don't think it's necessarily a race, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Well --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I don't --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: -- you went off and passed -- you went off --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: -- passed the very same day, and I --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: -- presume you did it for purpose.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: And that was to beat them to the courthouse, right?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Well, yes, sir.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Alright.[Laughter]
Now -- now, let me ask you -- let me ask you this.
Do you think that Congress when it passed the 1958 law intended to create a situation of that kind?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: They could have prevented it, and I don't -- I don't feel that they did prevent it.
They could have said or file.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: But you -- would you say that -- that the intention of Congress was, at that condition, should prevail?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I do not know, sir.
I doubt that they would want to create a situation where there would be races to the courthouse.

However -- nevertheless, if we are entitled to file a direct action in the -- in the federal court regardless of whether they are entitled to file one in the state court, I don't think the time element is necessarily controlling if we are, in fact, entitled under the diversity jurisdiction to file a lawsuit.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Yes, but we are -- we are, are we not, trying to find out what the intention of Congress was in that 1958 Act?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.
And I believe that they knew at the time that it was enacted that they were about 1100 of these lawsuits removed every year and about 900 of them file directly.
And they did not bar the filing of any of them.
And the employee can still, if he desires to, file 900 of these cases in Texas every year.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: How many of those 900 were filed by the insurance companies?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I think 28.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I'm sorry, sir, 25 out of 982.
25 were filled by the insurance company.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: But Congress said that it -- it intended to permit employees to continue to have that freedom of choice, isn't it?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir, but -- yes, sir.
They also knew at the same time that there were 25 out of these 2000 lawsuits that were being filed by insurance companies as plaintiffs to appeal --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: But they --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: -- from (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: No, sir.

They didn't say that they should but they recognized that they did previously have the right and then they didn't subsequently bar them by saying, "A defendant or an insurer cannot remove a case" and they could have said, "or filed."
But they knew at same time that 25 out of these 2000 lawsuits were being filled as plaintiffs by -- directed by insurance companies.
The -- the award of the Board or to talk about an appeal this is, in fact, a -- a new lawsuit, it's an original action.

It is a lawsuit in which --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb

So that the -- the --

turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Is this also true in the state court?

turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter

turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I mean what --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: So that on your -- on your complaint, you simply said this is a suit under Texas statute and diversity jurisdiction.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But if the Chief Justice's supposition were then taking up by the motion to dismiss or whatever it is in which they say we disavow an amount beyond $9,000, then on the face of the pleading, and you don't contradict -- you -- whether -- that would be controlling, wouldn't be?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.
Once he comes in and answers and said, "No, we don't claim $14,000."

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: He claimed $9,000, then you say the court is --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I think --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- is ousted of jurisdiction.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb

Or --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Pardon me.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Well, could you not judicially -- a plaintiff judicially admit himself out of federal jurisdiction?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: You say that the contract cost for whatever it is, $25,000 adding up to what we're recovering -- potentially covered $25,000.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I think it would be judicial admission if --

turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: -- the person claiming -- claiming the amount of $14,000 later says "No, I'm --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And you say there's no such things are placed here?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: No, sir.
He -- he cross it for $14,035 just to see a claime before the Industrial Accident Board.
And six days later, they filed a suit in Orange County, Texas for $14,000 for the same amount.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Did you mean --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: So --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: -- if he sued for $25,000 -- I'm not quite sure about that, sued for $25,000 for personal injury, after he filed the suit, he comes in and says "I am not going to reduce this.

Could he have it removed back to the state court then or have it dismiss for want of jurisdiction?
I'm not sure about that (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I'm -- I'm not sure either, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I have had some cases whether they denied me that right (Inaudible) [Laughs] for that.

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I know in --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I don't see how you can keep them in the federal court.
How can you keep them if you say I now bind myself to not want more than $9000?
How could you keep them in the federal court?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: I -- I don't know.
I know this is true in land cases, Your Honor, that if --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: How you could keep them there?

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I don't how he could.

turn.text: (Voice Overlap) --

turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb
turn.text: Then I --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: -- is that right?

turn.speaker: howell_cobb

turn.text: Well, Mr. Cobb --

turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb

turn.speaker: howell_cobb

turn.text: It is --

turn.speaker: howell_cobb
turn.label: Mr. Howell Cobb

turn.speaker: earl_warren

turn.speaker: howell_cobb

turn.text: -- before the Board.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Before you sit down, Mr. VenDercreek.
I'd like to ask this question.
In -- what is on the plaintiff's original complaint, the insurance case, it says the result -- the -- the claim the sum of $14,000.

When your motion to dismiss, you say that the award of $1050, what I want to know is would that statement of the award find any place if the case went to trial either in the state or the federal court?

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: The award which -- which, itself, is -- supersedes the administrative claim is, in itself, set aside by the filing of the suit.
When you file a suit to set aside the Board's award --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Would the fact -- I didn't make my question clear.
Would the fact that there was an award in amount of $1050, he allowed to appear in the litigation even in the state or federal court.

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: No, Your Honor.
Mr. Cobb gave absolutely --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Alright.

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: -- the correct answer --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: They don't (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: -- neither with the claim filed before the Board.
But you have to put --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: (Voice Overlap) -- pleadings to the jury, I gather in your --

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: Not and then ask could you -- it's jurisdictional of the award and the claim, a matter which is explained in the Booth, and you do have to put in your pleadings and as he did, I believe, it's on page -- top of page 3 of the record, asked for it to be set aside.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But the fact of the amount would not appear -- would have to be kept out of the litigation in the court.

turn.speaker: william_vandercreek
turn.label: Mr. William Vandercreek
turn.text: Yes, he cannot tell the jury, "You got an award for such and such."
It goes to the court and not to the jury.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Very well.
